analyzed: dhammasaṅgaṇī
translated: The Numerical Discourses

analyzed: niddesa
translated: The Analyses
The Chapter on Arising of Thoughts
Resultant Thoughts without Ascention

analyzed: kiriyā manaḥ dhātu
translated: Resultant mind-element

original: Katame dhammā abyākatā?🔽Yasmiṁ samaye manodhātu uppannā hoti kiriyā neva kusalā nākusalā na ca kammavipākā upekkhāsahagatā rūpārammaṇā vā …pe…
analyzed: katame dhammā a byākatā  yasmin samaye manaḥ dhātu uppannā hoti kiriyā na iva kusalā na akusalā na ca kamma vipākāḥ upekkhā sahagatāḥ rūpa ārammaṇāḥ vā pe
translated: What are unwholesome thoughts?🔽When the mind-element has arisen that is neither wholesome nor unwholesome, that has no result, and is accompanied by equanimity, connected with the sphere of visible form …🔽connected with the sphere of mind-objects …

original: phoṭṭhabbārammaṇā vā yaṁ yaṁ vā panārabbha, tasmiṁ samaye phasso hoti, vedanā hoti,
analyzed: phoṭṭhabba ārammaṇāḥ vā yam yam vā pana ārabbha tasmin samaye phassaḥ hoti vedanā hoti
translated: at that time contact exists, feeling exists,

original: saññā hoti, cetanā hoti, cittaṁ hoti, vitakko hoti, vicāro hoti, upekkhā hoti, cittassekaggatā
analyzed: saññā hoti cetanā hoti cittam hoti vitakkaḥ hoti vicāraḥ hoti upekkhā hoti cittassa ekagga tā
translated: perception exists, intention exists, citta exists, applied thought exists, sustained thought exists, equanimity exists, one-pointedness of mind exists,

original: hoti, manindriyaṁ hoti, upekkhindriyaṁ hoti, jīvitindriyaṁ hoti;🔽ye vā pana tasmiṁ samaye aññepi atthi paṭiccasamuppannā arūpino dhammā—
analyzed: hoti manindriyam hoti upekkhindriyam hoti jīvitindriyam hoti  ye vā pana tasmin samaye aññe pi atthi paṭiccasamuppannāḥ arūpino dhammā
translated: the mind faculty exists, the equanimity faculty exists, the life faculty exists;

analyzed: ime dhammā a byākatā pe
translated: whatever other conditioned phenomena there are that are mental factors, these are the unwholesome thoughts.

original: Tasmiṁ kho pana samaye cattāro khandhā honti, dvāyatanāni honti, dve dhātuyo honti,
analyzed: tasmin kho pana samaye cattāraḥ khandhāḥ honti dvā āyatanāni honti dve dhātuyaḥ honti
translated: At that time, there are four aggregates, two sense-spheres, two elements,

original: tayo āhārā honti, tīṇindriyāni honti, eko phasso hoti …pe… ekā manodhātu hoti, ekaṁ🔽dhammāyatanaṁ hoti, ekā dhammadhātu hoti;
analyzed: tayaḥ āhārāḥ honti tīṇi indriyāni honti ekaḥ phassaḥ hoti pe ekā manaḥ dhātu hoti eka  dhamma āyatanam hoti ekā dhammadhātu hoti
translated: there are three nutriments, there are three faculties, there is one kind of contact … there is one kind of mind element,🔽there is one kind of mind object, there is one kind of mind-consciousness element;

original: ye vā pana tasmiṁ samaye aññepi atthi paṭiccasamuppannā arūpino dhammā—🔽ime dhammā abyākatā …pe….🔽Katamo tasmiṁ samaye saṅkhārakkhandho hoti?🔽Phasso cetanā vitakko vicāro cittassekaggatā jīvitindriyaṁ;🔽ye vā pana tasmiṁ samaye aññepi atthi paṭiccasamuppannā arūpino dhammā ṭhapetvā vedanākkhandhaṁ ṭhapetvā saññākkhandhaṁ ṭhapetvā viññāṇakkhandhaṁ—🔽ayaṁ tasmiṁ samaye saṅkhārakkhandho hoti …pe…🔽ime dhammā abyākatā.🔽Kiriyā manodhātu.🔽2.1.10.2. original: Yasmiṁ samaye manoviññāṇadhātu uppannā hoti kiriyā neva kusalā nākusalā na ca kammavipākā somanassasahagatā rūpārammaṇā vā …pe…🔽dhammārammaṇā vā yaṁ yaṁ vā panārabbha, tasmiṁ samaye phasso hoti, vedanā hoti, saññā
analyzed: yasmin samaye manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu uppannā hoti kiriyā na iva kusalā na akusalā na ca kamma vipākā somanassa sahagatā rūpa ārammaṇā vā pe dhamma ārammaṇāḥ vā yam yam vā pana ārabbha tasmin samaye phassaḥ hoti vedanā hoti saññā
translated: At whatever time he develops the mind-consciousness element that is neither wholesome nor unwholesome, nor the result of action, that is accompanied by equanimity, and has form as its object…🔽… has sound as its object…🔽has odour as its object…🔽has taste as its object…🔽has the tangible as its object…

original: hoti, cetanā hoti, cittaṁ hoti, vitakko hoti, vicāro hoti, pīti hoti, sukhaṁ hoti,
analyzed: hoti cetanā hoti cittam hoti vitakkaḥ hoti vicāraḥ hoti pīti hoti sukham hoti
translated: has a mental property as its object, or has a whatever as its object, at that time contact exists, feeling exists, perception exists, volition exists, thought exists, applied thought exists, sustained thought exists, happiness exists, tranquillity exists,

original: cittassekaggatā hoti, vīriyindriyaṁ hoti, samādhindriyaṁ hoti, manindriyaṁ hoti,
analyzed: cittassa ekagga tā hoti vīriya indriyam hoti samādhi indriyam hoti manindriyam hoti
translated: the mindfulness faculty exists, the concentration faculty exists, the mind faculty exists,

analyzed: somanassindriyam hoti jīvitindriyam hoti
translated: the equanimity faculty exists, the life faculty exists;

original: ye vā pana tasmiṁ samaye aññepi atthi paṭiccasamuppannā arūpino dhammā—
analyzed: ye vā pana tasmin samaye aññe pi atthi paṭiccasamuppannāḥ arūpino dhammā
translated: or whatever other conditioned phenomena there are that are mental factors, these are the meritorious dhammas.

analyzed: ime dhammā a byākatā
translated: These are the indeterminate dhammas.

original: Katamo tasmiṁ samaye phasso hoti?🔽Yo tasmiṁ samaye phasso phusanā samphusanā samphusitattaṁ—
analyzed: katamaḥ tasmin samaye phassaḥ hoti  yaḥ tasmin samaye phassaḥ
translated: What is contact at that time?🔽That which at that time is contact, being in contact, contacting,

analyzed: ayam tasmin samaye phassaḥ hoti pe
translated: this is the contact at that time.

analyzed: katamā tasmin samaye cittassa ekagga tā hoti
translated: What is one-pointedness of mind at that time?

original: Yā tasmiṁ samaye cittassa ṭhiti saṇṭhiti avaṭṭhiti avisāhāro avikkhepo avisāhaṭamānasatā samatho samādhindriyaṁ samādhibalaṁ—
analyzed: yā tasmin samaye cittassa ṭhiti saṇṭhiti avaṭṭhiti a visāhāraḥ a vikkhepaḥ a visāhaṭa mānasa tā samatho samādhi indriyam samādhi bala
translated: Whatever at that time is stability of awareness, steadiness of awareness, absorption by way of steadiness of awareness, unification of awareness, non-distraction of awareness, the faculty of concentration, the power of concentration, right concentration—

analyzed: ayam tasmin samaye cittassa ekagga tā hoti
translated: this is, at that time, unification of mind.

analyzed: katamam tasmin samaye vīriyindriyam ha uti
translated: What, at that time, is the concentration faculty?

original: Yo tasmiṁ samaye cetasiko vīriyārambho nikkamo parakkamo uyyāmo vāyāmo ussāho ussoḷhī🔽thāmo dhiti asithilaparakkamatā anikkhittachandatā anikkhittadhuratā dhurasampaggāho🔽vīriyaṁ vīriyindriyaṁ vīriyabalaṁ—
analyzed: yaḥ tasmin samaye cetasikaḥ vīriya ārambhaḥ nikkamaḥ parakkamaḥ uyyāmaḥ vāyāmaḥ ussāhaḥ ussoḷhī  thāmaḥ a sithila parakkama tā a nikkhitta chanda tā a nikkhitta dhura tā dhura sampaggāhaḥ  vīriyam vīriya indriyam vīriya bala
translated: Whatever, at that time, is endeavour, exertion, effort, committed striving, warlikeness, endeavour of the mind, energy, energy as a faculty, energy as a power, right effort—

analyzed: idam tasmin samaye vīriyindriyam ha uti
translated: this, at that time, is the concentration faculty.

original: Katamaṁ tasmiṁ samaye samādhindriyaṁ hoti?🔽Yā tasmiṁ samaye cittassa ṭhiti saṇṭhiti avaṭṭhiti avisāhāro avikkhepo avisāhaṭamānasatā samatho samādhindriyaṁ samādhibalaṁ—
analyzed: katamam tasmin samaye samādhi indriyam ha uti  yā tasmin samaye cittassa ṭhiti saṇṭhiti avaṭṭhiti a visāhāraḥ a vikkhepaḥ a visāhaṭa mānasa tā samatho samādhi indriyam samādhi bala
translated: What, at that time, is the concentration faculty?🔽Whatever at that time is stability of awareness, steadiness of awareness, absorption by way of steadiness of awareness, unification of awareness, non-distraction of awareness, the faculty of concentration, the power of concentration, right concentration—

analyzed: idam tasmin samaye samādhi indriyam hoti pe
translated: this, at that time, is the concentration faculty. …

original: ye vā pana tasmiṁ samaye aññepi atthi paṭiccasamuppannā arūpino dhammā—
analyzed: ye vā pana tasmin samaye aññe pi atthi paṭiccasamuppannāḥ arūpino dhammā
translated: Whatever other incorporeal, causally induced phenomena there are at that time—

analyzed: ime dhammā a byākatā
translated: these phenomena are indeterminate.

original: Tasmiṁ kho pana samaye cattāro khandhā honti, dvāyatanāni honti, dve dhātuyo honti,🔽tayo āhārā honti, pañcindriyāni honti, eko phasso hoti …pe… ekā manoviññāṇadhātu
analyzed: tasmin kho pana samaye cattāraḥ khandhāḥ honti dvā āyatanāni honti dve dhātuyaḥ honti  tayaḥ āhārāḥ honti pañca indriyāni honti ekaḥ phassaḥ hoti pe ekā manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu
translated: At that time there are four components, two media, two elements,

original: hoti, ekaṁ dhammāyatanaṁ hoti, ekā dhammadhātu hoti;
analyzed: hoti ekam dhamma āyatanam hoti ekā dhammadhātu hoti
translated: three nutriments, five faculties, one contact, one feeling, one perception, one volition, one consciousness, one intention, one element;

original: ye vā pana tasmiṁ samaye aññepi atthi paṭiccasamuppannā arūpino dhammā—
analyzed: ye vā pana tasmin samaye aññe pi atthi paṭiccasamuppannāḥ arūpino dhammā
translated: or whatever other incorporeal, causally induced phenomena there are at that time—

analyzed: ime dhammā a byākatā pe
translated: these phenomena are indeterminate.

analyzed: katamaḥ tasmin samaye saṅkhāra kkhandho hoti
translated: What at that time is the formations aggregate?

original: Phasso cetanā vitakko vicāro pīti cittassekaggatā vīriyindriyaṁ samādhindriyaṁ jīvitindriyaṁ;
analyzed: phasso cetanā vitakko vicāro pīti cittassa ekagga tā vīriya indriyam samādhi indriyam jīvitindriya
translated: Contact, volition, applied thought, sustained thought, happiness, unification of mind, the faculty of energy, the faculty of concentration, the faculty of life;

original: ye vā pana tasmiṁ samaye aññepi atthi paṭiccasamuppannā arūpino dhammā ṭhapetvā vedanākkhandhaṁ ṭhapetvā saññākkhandhaṁ ṭhapetvā viññāṇakkhandhaṁ—
analyzed: ye vā pana tasmin samaye aññe pi atthi paṭiccasamuppannāḥ arūpino dhammāḥ ṭhapetvā vedanā kkhandham ṭhapetvā saññā kkhandham ṭhapetvā viññāṇa kkhandham
translated: or whatever other incorporeal, causally induced phenomena there are at that time, apart from feeling, perception, and consciousness—

analyzed: ayam tasmin samaye saṅkhāra kkhandho hoti pe
translated: at that time there is the volitions aggregate …

analyzed: ime dhammā a byākatā  kiriyā manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu somanassa sahagatā
translated: These are the states that are indeterminate.🔽The mind element that is resultant and is accompanied by equanimity.

analyzed: kiriyā manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu upekkhā sahagata
translated: The mind element that is resultant and is accompanied by equanimity.

analyzed: katame dhammā a byākatā
translated: What are the states that are indeterminate?

original: Yasmiṁ samaye manoviññāṇadhātu uppannā hoti kiriyā neva kusalā nākusalā na ca kammavipākā upekkhāsahagatā rūpārammaṇā vā …pe…
analyzed: yasmin samaye manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu uppannā hoti kiriyā na iva kusalā na akusalā na ca kamma vipākāḥ upekkhā sahagatāḥ rūpa ārammaṇāḥ vā pe
translated: On an occasion when the mind element has arisen that is neither wholesome nor unwholesome, nor a result of (previous) wholesome or unwholesome (action), but is accompanied by equanimity, and has form as its object …

original: dhammārammaṇā vā yaṁ yaṁ vā panārabbha, tasmiṁ samaye phasso hoti, vedanā hoti, saññā
analyzed: dhamma ārammaṇāḥ vā yam yam vā pana ārabbha tasmin samaye phassaḥ hoti vedanā hoti saññā
translated: or has the dhammas as its object, whatever is its object, at that time there is contact, there is feeling, there is perception,

original: hoti, cetanā hoti, cittaṁ hoti, vitakko hoti, vicāro hoti, upekkhā hoti, cittassekaggatā
analyzed: hoti cetanā hoti cittam hoti vitakkaḥ hoti vicāraḥ hoti upekkhā hoti cittassa ekagga tā
translated: there is intention, there is thought, there is equanimity, there is one-pointedness of mind,

original: hoti, vīriyindriyaṁ hoti, samādhindriyaṁ hoti manindriyaṁ hoti, upekkhindriyaṁ hoti, jīvitindriyaṁ hoti;
analyzed: hoti vīriya indriyam hoti samādhi indriyam hoti manindriyam hoti upekkhindriyam hoti jīvitindriyam hoti
translated: there is the faith faculty, there is the mindfulness faculty, there is the concentration faculty, there is the equanimity faculty, there is the life faculty,

original: ye vā pana tasmiṁ samaye aññepi atthi paṭiccasamuppannā arūpino dhammā—
analyzed: ye vā pana tasmin samaye aññe pi atthi paṭiccasamuppannāḥ arūpino dhammā
translated: or whatever other incorporeal, causally induced dhammas there are at that time -🔽these are states that are indeterminate.

analyzed: ime dhammā a byākatā pe
translated: These are unwholesome thoughts. …🔽These are wholesome thoughts. …

original: Tasmiṁ kho pana samaye cattāro khandhā honti, dvāyatanāni honti, dve dhātuyo honti,🔽tayo āhārā honti, pañcindriyāni honti, eko phasso hoti …pe… ekā manoviññāṇadhātu
analyzed: tasmin kho pana samaye cattāraḥ khandhāḥ honti dvā āyatanāni honti dve dhātuyaḥ honti  tayaḥ āhārāḥ honti pañca indriyāni honti ekaḥ phassaḥ hoti pe ekā manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu
translated: At that time there are four aggregates, two sense-spheres, two elements,🔽three nutriments, five faculties, one contact, … one perception, … one intention, … one consciousness aggregate, …

original: hoti, ekaṁ dhammāyatanaṁ hoti, ekā dhammadhātu hoti;
analyzed: hoti ekam dhamma āyatanam hoti ekā dhammadhātu hoti
translated: one mind element, … one mind-consciousness element, … one thing unconditioned, …

original: ye vā pana tasmiṁ samaye aññepi atthi paṭiccasamuppannā arūpino dhammā—
analyzed: ye vā pana tasmin samaye aññe pi atthi paṭiccasamuppannāḥ arūpino dhammā
translated: or whatever other incorporeal, causally induced phenomena there are on that occasion—

analyzed: ime dhammā a byākatā pe
translated: these are states that are indeterminate. …

analyzed: katamaḥ tasmin samaye saṅkhāra kkhandho hoti
translated: What at that time is the aggregate of volitional formations?

original: Phasso cetanā vitakko vicāro cittassekaggatā vīriyindriyaṁ samādhindriyaṁ jīvitindriyaṁ;
analyzed: phasso cetanā vitakko vicāro cittassa ekagga tā vīriya indriyam samādhi indriyam jīvita indriya
translated: Contact, volition, applied thought, sustained thought, one-pointedness of mind, the faculty of energy, the faculty of concentration, the faculty of life,

original: ye vā pana tasmiṁ samaye aññepi atthi paṭiccasamuppannā arūpino dhammā ṭhapetvā vedanākkhandhaṁ ṭhapetvā saññākkhandhaṁ ṭhapetvā viññāṇakkhandhaṁ—
analyzed: ye vā pana tasmin samaye aññe pi atthi paṭiccasamuppannāḥ arūpino dhammāḥ ṭhapetvā vedanā kkhandham ṭhapetvā saññā kkhandham ṭhapetvā viññāṇa kkhandham
translated: or whatever other incorporeal, causally induced phenomena there are on that occasion, apart from feeling, apart from perception, apart from the aggregate of consciousness—

analyzed: ayam tasmin samaye saṅkhāra kkhandho hoti pe
translated: this at that time is the aggregate of volitional formations. …

analyzed: ime dhammā a byākatā
translated: these are states that are indeterminate.

analyzed: kiriyā manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu upekkhā sahagatā
translated: The functional mind-consciousness element that is accompanied by equanimity.

analyzed: ahetukā kiriyā abyākatā
translated: The functional without root-cause is indeterminate.

analyzed: sa hetuka kāmāvacara kiriyā
translated: … The functional of the sense sphere that has root-cause

analyzed: katame dhammā a byākatā
translated: What are the indeterminate ideas?

original: Yasmiṁ samaye manoviññāṇadhātu uppannā hoti kiriyā neva kusalā nākusalā na ca kammavipākā somanassasahagatā ñāṇasampayuttā …pe…🔽somanassasahagatā ñāṇasampayuttā sasaṅkhārena …pe…
analyzed: yasmin samaye manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu uppannā hoti kiriyā na iva kusalā na akusalā na ca kamma vipākā somanassa sahagatā ñāṇa sampayuttā pe  somanassa sahagatā ñāṇa sampayuttā sa saṅkhārena pe
translated: At whatever time he develops the mind-consciousness element that is neither wholesome nor unwholesome, nor the result of these, that is accompanied by equanimity, is accompanied by knowledge, is associated with the resort to mindfulness, is associated with the resort to equanimity, is concentrated on a single thing, and has a form object, or a sound object, or a tangible object, or whatever object among the ideas, at that time there is contact … down to …

analyzed: somanassa sahagatāḥ ñāṇa vippayuttāḥ pe  somanassa sahagatā ñāṇa vippayuttā sa saṅkhārena pe
translated: … is associated with the resort to mindfulness, is associated with the resort to equanimity, is concentrated on a single thing, and has a form object, or a sound object, or a tangible object, or whatever object among the ideas, at that time there is contact … down to …

analyzed: upekkhā sahagatā ñāṇa sampayuttā pe
translated: … is associated with the resort to mindfulness, is associated with the resort to equanimity, is concentrated on a single thing, and has a form object, or a sound object, or a tangible object, or whatever object among the ideas, at that time there is contact … down to …

original: upekkhāsahagatā ñāṇasampayuttā sasaṅkhārena …pe…🔽upekkhāsahagatā ñāṇavippayuttā …pe…🔽upekkhāsahagatā ñāṇavippayuttā sasaṅkhārena rūpārammaṇā vā …pe…
analyzed: upekkhā sahagatā ñāṇa sampayuttā sa saṅkhārena pe  upekkhā sahagatā ñāṇa vippayuttā pe  upekkhā sahagatā ñāṇa vippayuttā sa saṅkhārena rūpa ārammaṇā vā pe
translated: … is associated with the resort to mindfulness, is associated with the resort to equanimity, is concentrated on a single thing, and has a form object, or a sound object, or a tangible object, or whatever object among the ideas, at that time there is contact … down to …🔽… is associated with the resort to mindfulness, is associated with the resort to equanimity, is concentrated on a single thing, and has a form object, or a sound object, or a tangible object, or whatever object among the ideas, at that time there is contact … down to …🔽… is associated with the resort to mindfulness, is associated with the resort to equanimity, is concentrated on a single thing, and has a form object, or a sound object, or a tangible object, or whatever object among the ideas, at that time there is contact … down to …

original: dhammārammaṇā vā yaṁ yaṁ vā panārabbha, tasmiṁ samaye phasso hoti …pe… avikkhepo hoti …pe…
analyzed: dhamma ārammaṇāḥ vā yam yam vā pana ārabbha tasmin samaye phassaḥ hoti pe avikkhepaḥ hoti pe
translated: … is associated with the resort to mindfulness, is associated with the resort to equanimity, is concentrated on a single thing, and has a form object, or a sound object, or a tangible object, or whatever object among the ideas, at that time there is contact … down to …

analyzed: ime dhammā a byākatā pe
translated: … is associated with the resort to mindfulness, is associated with the resort to equanimity, is concentrated

analyzed: alobhaḥ abyākata mūlam pe
translated: Non-greed is a root of the indeterminate. …

analyzed: a dosaḥ a byākata mūlam
translated: Non-hate is a root of the indeterminate. …

analyzed: ime dhammā a byākatā  sa hetukā kāmāvacara kiriyā
translated: These are indeterminate ideas.🔽With root-cause ideas of the sense sphere that are inoperative.

analyzed: rūpāvacara kiriyā
translated: … With root-cause ideas of the fine-material sphere that are inoperative.

original: Katame dhammā abyākatā?🔽Yasmiṁ samaye rūpāvacaraṁ jhānaṁ bhāveti kiriyaṁ neva kusalaṁ nākusalaṁ na ca kammavipākaṁ🔽diṭṭhadhammasukhavihāraṁ vivicceva kāmehi …pe… paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati
analyzed: katame dhammā a byākatā  yasmin samaye rūpāvacaram jhānam bhāveti kiriyam na iva kusalam na akusalam na ca kamma vipāka  diṭṭhadhamma sukha vihāram vivicca iva kāmehi pe paṭhamam jhānam upasampajja viharati
translated: What are indeterminate ideas?

original: pathavīkasiṇaṁ, tasmiṁ samaye phasso hoti …pe… avikkhepo hoti …pe…
analyzed: tasmin samaye phassaḥ hoti pe avikkhepaḥ hoti pe
translated: When one cultivates the fine-material-sphere jhāna that is inoperative, neither meritorious nor demeritorious, nor ripening into results of past action, and one abides in it, having entered it by completely transcending perceptions of matter, by the disappearance of perceptions of resistance, by non-attention to perceptions of variety, thinking “Space is infinite,” then at that time contact arises … non-distraction arises …

analyzed: ime dhammā a byākatā
translated: These are indeterminate ideas.

original: Katame dhammā abyākatā?🔽Yasmiṁ samaye rūpāvacaraṁ jhānaṁ bhāveti kiriyaṁ neva kusalaṁ nākusalaṁ na ca kammavipākaṁ diṭṭhadhammasukhavihāraṁ vitakkavicārānaṁ vūpasamā …pe… dutiyaṁ jhānaṁ …pe…🔽tatiyaṁ jhānaṁ …pe…🔽catutthaṁ jhānaṁ …pe…
analyzed: katame dhammā a byākatā  yasmin samaye rūpāvacaram jhānam bhāveti kiriyam na iva kusalam na akusalam na ca kamma vipākam diṭṭhadhamma sukha vihāram vitakka vicārānam vūpasamā pe dutiyam jhānam pe  tatiyam jhānam  catuttham jhānam pe
translated: What are indeterminate ideas?🔽When one cultivates the fine-material-sphere jhāna that is inoperative, neither meritorious nor demeritorious, nor ripening into results of past action, and one abides in it, having entered it by completely transcending the base of infinite space, thinking “Consciousness is infinite,” then at that time contact arises … non-distraction arises …

analyzed: paṭhamam jhānam
translated: When one cultivates the fine-material-sphere jhāna that is inoperative, neither meritorious nor demeritorious, nor ripening into results of past action, and one abides in it, having entered it by completely transcending the base of infinite consciousness, thinking “There is nothing,” then at that time contact arises … non-distraction arises …🔽When one cultivates the fine-material-sphere jhāna that is inoperative, neither meritorious nor demeritorious, nor ripening into results of past action, and one abides in it, having entered it by completely transcending the base of nothingness, and thinking “This is peaceful, this is sublime,” then at that time contact arises … non-distraction arises …🔽When one cultivates the fine-material-sphere jhāna that is inoperative, neither meritorious nor demeritorious, nor ripening into results of past action, and one abides in it, having entered it by completely transcending the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, then at that time contact arises … non-distraction arises …

original: pañcamaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati pathavīkasiṇaṁ, tasmiṁ samaye phasso hoti …pe… avikkhepo hoti …pe…
analyzed: pañcamam jhānam upasampajja viharati pathavīkasiṇa tasmin samaye phassaḥ hoti pe avikkhepaḥ hoti pe
translated: at that time there is contact … and so on as in §107 up to …

analyzed: ime dhammā a byākatā  rūpāvacara kiriyā
translated: These are the unwholesome thoughts.

analyzed: arūpa avacara kiriyā
translated: The Formless-Worldly Resultants

analyzed: katame dhammā a byākatā
translated: What are the indeterminate thoughts?

original: Yasmiṁ samaye arūpāvacaraṁ jhānaṁ bhāveti kiriyaṁ neva kusalaṁ nākusalaṁ na ca kammavipākaṁ
analyzed: yasmin samaye arūpāvacaram jhānam bhāveti kiriyam na iva kusalam na akusalam na ca kamma vipāka
translated: When one cultivates the formless-world meditation that is neither wholesome nor unwholesome nor the result of past action,

original: diṭṭhadhammasukhavihāraṁ sabbaso rūpasaññānaṁ samatikkamā paṭighasaññānaṁ atthaṅgamā
analyzed: diṭṭhadhamma sukha vihāram sabbasas rūpa saññānam samatikkamā paṭigha saññānaṃ atthaṅgamā
translated: that is a pleasant abiding in the here and now, having completely transcended the sphere of infinite consciousness, thinking ‘space is infinite’,🔽having completely transcended the sphere of nothingness, thinking ‘this is not’,

original: nānattasaññānaṁ amanasikārā ākāsānañcāyatanasaññāsahagataṁ sukhassa ca pahānā …pe…
analyzed: nānatta saññānam amanasikārā ākāsa anañcāyatana saññā sahagatam sukhassa ca pahānā pe
translated: having completely transcended the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, thinking ‘this is peaceful, this is sublime’,

original: catutthaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati tasmiṁ samaye phasso hoti …pe… avikkhepo hoti …pe…
analyzed: catuttham jhānam upasampajja viharati tasmin samaye phassaḥ hoti pe avikkhepaḥ hoti pe
translated: at that time there is contact … and so on as in §107 up to …

analyzed: ime dhammā a byākatā
translated: These are the indeterminate thoughts.

analyzed: katame dhammā a byākatā
translated: What are the indeterminate thoughts?

original: Yasmiṁ samaye arūpāvacaraṁ jhānaṁ bhāveti kiriyaṁ neva kusalaṁ nākusalaṁ na ca kammavipākaṁ
analyzed: yasmin samaye arūpāvacaram jhānam bhāveti kiriyam na iva kusalam na akusalam na ca kamma vipāka

analyzed: diṭṭhadhamma sukha vihāram sabbaso ākiñcaññāyatanam samatikkamma nevasaññānāsaññāyatana saññā sahagata  sukhassa ca pahānā pe catuttham jhānam upasampajja viharati tasmin samaye phasso
